This cozy 2 bedroom home features an updated kitchen with granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, and a separate dining area with seating for six. The bedrooms share a full bath between them. Feel free to bring an extra friend since this home has a comfy queen sized sleeper sofa and cable TV in the living room, and a bonus futon (futon does not come with linens) in dining area. Enjoy a meal under the covered patio, rinse off your feet under the outdoor shower after a trip to the beach, play with your dog in the fenced backyard, or take a break from the sun and watch TV in the living room! Washer/dryer included (in same room as dining and futon). Charcoal grill. Linens Included. Wi-Fi. No smoking. Vehicle Capacity: 3 ---LAYOUT--- First Floor: Off street parking Covered patio with picnic table and charcoal grill Fenced yard with outdoor shower Living area with queen sleeper sofa (sheets provided) and Flat screen RokuTV Kitchen Dining area with futon (no sheets provided); washer and dryer; access to covered patio Bedroom 1: Queen Bed; shares Jack and Jill full bath (shower/tub combo) with Bedroom 2. Bedroom 2: (2) Twin beds; shares Jack and Jill full bath (shower/tub combo) with Bedroom 1. Dog permitted with $200 non-refundable pet fee. *This home has a 3 night minimum year round.* Permit # P-00991 Read more Availability Calendar Availability Calendar For last minute bookings within 48 Overall satisfaction Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Services from rental manager Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Cleanliness Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Location Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Property condition Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Recommend to Others Yes Anonymous - Posted: October 2023 Rating 5 Great Little House This house is so perfect for a small family or 4 adults. 10 out of 10! Amy S from Greenville - Posted: October 2023 Rating 4 cozy cottage I had a great experience. cozy and comfortable. and the a/c was able to keep up with my ice cold standards of 67-69. Location awesome. only one house away from the regular beach parking.Just have a few points of improvement to suggest but was very happy for the price. 1-Ants and mosquitos were overly zealous at this hose particular. May need pest control. sidewalks were constantly covered with ants that would climb your legs given .5 seconds of a chance. The mosquitos were very specific to this property. taking our dog for walks the mosquitos would not bother you until you walked back on this property. so Im assuming the other properties had spraying done which we witnessed on a few house while there.2- Wife had to deep clean a pot that had burnt on food on the bottom. the large boiler pot had significant burnt areas that took some time to remove. 3- drainage/water runoff by side door sunroom was directed along the back door almost overflowing into the house. may need some drainage adjustment on that area.4- there is a rinse shower in the backyard, great asset, however you have to access it from the side yard from the side of the driveway and walk across the dirt. so once you rinse off you have to walk back across the dirt to the concrete to get into the house with no hose connection to rinse feet or sandals off again. suggest running the piping down to the little storage fence area behind the picnic area and putting shower in there for easier cleanup and rinsing. Not a deal breaker but a way to make the experience a level better. Overall satisfaction Rating Rating Rating Rating Services from rental manager Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Cleanliness Rating Rating Rating Rating Location Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Property condition Rating Rating Rating Rating Recommend to Others Yes Anonymous from courtand - Posted: August 2023 Rating 5 Yearly trip Enjoyed our stay. We come to IOP every year and wanted to get a house instead of a condo. Everyone was nice and it is located right by Public beach entrance. Will use them again Overall satisfaction Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Services from rental manager Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Cleanliness Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Location Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Property condition Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Recommend to Others Yes Anonymous from Blythewood - Posted: August 2023 Rating 4 Clean cottage but yard needs work This house was extremely clean. The kitchen, bedrooms and living room were perfect. The bathroom is very small with no counter space at all. Nor is there a mirror (except a tiny one inside the medicine cabinet). The fenced in yard is the main reason we chose this place. However, it was very inconvenient as there is no easy access. You have to walk around the house to get to it. The outdoor shower is kind of pointless as you walk through dirt and sand to get to it. The ants are like nothing I've ever seen. I have lived and stayed in the south all of my 52 yrs of life and could not believe how bad they were. There was no spending any time outside. They even were biting our dog. We had to leave the property and just take him on walks around the neighborhood to get away from them. Thankfully none made it inside. The A/C unit made a horrible noise. The only time it stopped was when it wasn't running (which was hardly at all). It made it hard to hear the tv at times. Even though it still cooled, after a while, the noise was really grating on our nerves. Overall, the place was perfect for our needs. Just my husband and I and our dog for a few days. Don't know that I would want to stay there for a long period of time. I really don't like leaving any negative comments at all because it is a cute cottage and very clean. However, it just needs a few updates and some maintenance. Meredith W from Easley, SC - Posted: May 2023 Rating 5 Weekend get away cottage This property was almost exactly as described. The only surprise was that there is no access to the back yard from the house. You have to walk around the side of the house to get access. It had rained prior to our arrival so the paths to the yard was kinda muddy. It's a cute cottage with all maintained furnishings. It is only 1 block walk to the public beach access path. The street is quiet & not busy so no trouble getting into or out of driveway. There is a Harris Teeter grocery only about 2 miles up the road. We enjoyed a new restaurant, Islander 71 Beach House. It was very good. We went into Charleston Sunday. Only a short drive. Friday night's traffic was fine for us however, Saturday's traffic into the island for our friends was heavy. Sunday was no problem when going to Charleston. We'll be back & will definitely look into renting this home again. I also liked the coded entry. No keys to worry about! Overall satisfaction Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Services from rental manager Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Cleanliness Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Location Rating Rating Rating Rating Rating Property condition Rating Rating Rating Rating Recommend to Others Yes Anonymous from Whitmore Lake - Posted: October 2022 Rating 4 Best location! The house itself was immaculate and the location was amazing- however, there were ants everywhere outside to the point we could not be outside at all and when we checked in they were even coming inside at one point. We called the after hours line and let them know what was happening and they said that they couldn't do anything because it was not considered an emergency. We were pretty upset about it and ended up just going to buy ant spray to try to get it taken care of ourselves. The next day someone did come and spray for us, and the house itself was immaculate but we were just frustrated with the ants. The location was AMAZING and could not be beat! The house was stocked with everything we needed to cook, too. The ants were obviously out of anyone's control, it was just how the after hours company handled it that upset us. We will defiantly book through Island Realty again! Island Realty staff Rating 5 Clean Comfortable Convenient to beach home This was our first time to the low-country, and this home couldn't have been more conveniently located to the beach. It was about a 5 minute walk across the (unfortunately busy) street and down a walkway between the houses to reach the beach. We ate all our meals out except breakfast, the home had everything we needed for setting up a breakfast in the morning. As there were only two of us, the bathroom situation (one shared bathroom between the two bedrooms) was not an issue for us, but this could be an issue if there were more than two people. We appreciated the shower in the backyard to rinse off after returning from the beach. Having a washer/dryer in the house was wonderful, beach towels can be a mess. It was also convenient to get to Charleston from here, about a 30 min drive. For two of us, we would definitely rent this place again. We enjoyed "Acme Low Country Kitchen" restaurant (great seafood, She Crab soup is delicious), "Long Island Cafe" (for brunch, also great seafood), "Home Team BBQ" (on Sullivan's Island, great ribs, and we are from TX originally), and also went to the Charleston Crab House (downtown Charleston for a great crab boil). All of them are a bit more expensive, but that is expected in a beach town. Island Realty staff Rating 5 Clean Comfortable Convenient to beach home This was our first time to the low-country, and this home couldn't have been more conveniently located to the beach. It was about a 5 minute walk across the (unfortunately busy) street and down a walkway between the houses to reach the beach. We ate all our meals out except breakfast, the home had everything we needed for setting up a breakfast in the morning. As there were only two of us, the bathroom situation (one shared bathroom between the two bedrooms) was not an issue for us, but this could be an issue if there were more than two people. We appreciated the shower in the backyard to rinse off after returning from the beach. Having a washer/dryer in the house was wonderful, beach towels can be a mess. It was also convenient to get to Charleston from here, about a 30 min drive. For two of us, we would definitely rent this place again. We enjoyed "Acme Low Country Kitchen" restaurant (great seafood, She Crab soup is delicious), "Long Island Cafe" (for brunch, also great seafood), "Home Team BBQ" (on Sullivan's Island, great ribs, and we are from TX originally), and also went to the Charleston Crab House (downtown Charleston for a great crab boil). All of them are a bit more expensive, but that is expected in a beach town.
